meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction in which electrons are lost.
meanings.sent1: The metal was oxidating, losing its shiny surface.
meanings.sent2: Leaves oxidating in the sun turn brown over time.
meanings.sent3: The battery was oxidating so fast, it seemed like it was running a race.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was oxidating inside her, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The fire was oxidating the wood, turning it into ash.

meanings.definition: To cause a substance to combine with oxygen.
meanings.sent1: He was oxidating the iron to create rust for his art project.
meanings.sent2: The chef was oxidating the ingredients to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the oxidating agent, causing a small explosion.
meanings.sent4: The oxygen was oxidating the metal, forming a protective layer on its surface.
meanings.sent5: The process of oxidating the fuel releases energy for the engine to run.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal oxidates and develops a green patina.
meanings.sent2: The apple oxidated quickly once it was cut open.
meanings.sent3: The old car was slowly oxidating in the abandoned junkyard.
meanings.sent4: The statue oxidated in the rain, giving it a weathered look.
meanings.sent5: The copper oxidated, turning from shiny to dull brown.
